page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT - IDEN GREEN
page.content: {MAKER OF STRINGED INSTRUMENT:Mr Grigg began work as a Pattern and Model Maker, later teaching woodwork in Kent Schools. He became interested in violins, started doing repairs. This led to making{violins, violas}and {cellos.} The detailed and precision work in Pattern and Model making is now put to use in instrument making which he carries out in a small workshop in his garden. The front of a violin is made from Spruce - a soft wood; the top, neck and ribs from Maple - a hard wood. The combination of these two has been proved to give the best sound. Mr. Grigg also repairs bows and stringed instruments for schools and professional musicians. A highlight was being invited to Covent Garden, where one of his Cellos and a Viola were being played.
